messages.content: Dear friend, We face a big choice about our future as a country. We know that the Tories are pushing our NHS into a state of crisis and underfunding our schools while cutting taxes for the well off. They don't understand the pressures facing many families locally. And they have failed to invest in housing, skills or transport to help ensure the future growth and economic success of our city. As your MP, I have always stood up for our community, worked hard to help you through my regular advice surgeries and represented Leeds with passion. I have campaigned for better broadband across Leeds, won more funding for improved flood defenses for the city centre and supported many voluntary organisations right across the city - from Woodhouse to Middleland and from Burmantofts to Beeston and Holbeck. I do hope you will feel able to put your trust and confidence in me once again.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Under the Tories, NHS waiting lists are soaring, A&Es are overcrowded and it takes us longer to see our GP. Labour will ensure that our healthcare gets the funding it needs.
Labour will introduce the Real Living Wage of £10 an hour, give all primary school children free school meals and build more houses to meet local demand.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Getting the best deal from Brexit
keyPolicies.policyDescription: We respect the referendum result and want to leave the EU, but we must get the best deal for working people to ensure jobs and investment are protected.

issues.brexitEurope: Getting the best deal from Brexit: We respect the referendum result and want to leave the EU, but we must get the best deal for working people to ensure jobs and investment are protected.
issues.economy: Fairness and security for all: Labour will introduce the Real Living Wage of £10 an hour, give all primary school children free school meals and build more houses to meet local demand.

politicalExperience.achievements: I have campaigned for better broadband across Leeds, won more funding for improved flood defenses for the city centre and supported many voluntary organisations right across the city - from Woodhouse to Middleland and from Burmantofts to Beeston and Holbeck.

contactInformation.address: Hilary Benn, Unity Business Centre, 26 Roundhay Road, Leeds LS7 1AB

endorsements.endorsement: Hilary cares and is there for us when we need him. He works hard locally and always offers encouragement and support to community organisations. That's why I am backing him.
We want our elected representative to speak their mind and have the courage to lead. Hilary has these qualities and that's why he is widely respected locally and nationally.
Hilary is very approachable, a good listener, cares and works really hard to try and sort out people's problems. I am proud of him and that's why he is getting my vote.

images.caption: Hilary Benn - Labour candidate for Leeds Central
Help Labour keep our NHS safe - Labour will protect our NHS
